articles.title: Israel must answer for denying Canadian delegation’s entry, MPs tell Anand
articles.description: In a letter sent to Anand, NDP MP Jenny Kwan and Liberal MP Gurbux Saini called that behaviour "an egregious violation of personal dignity and basic diplomatic norms."

articles.title: Ghost jobs are the scourge of a deficient labour market
articles.description: Time is money, and ghost job postings – ones companies have no intention of filling – are wasting applicants’ time

articles.title: Montrealer pleads guilty to killing man in knife fight over a woman
articles.description: Uriel Pepin Rojas, 23, was initially charged with second-degree murder in the death of 23-year-old Liam Angelo Rodriguez, but pleaded guilty to manslaughter.

articles.title: Police seek witnesses after fatal crash on Highway 50 in Mirabel
articles.description: Quebec provincial police are asking the public for help as they investigate a deadly collision that happened earlier this month on Highway 50 in Mirabel. According to the Sûreté du Québec (SQ), the crash occurred on Dec. 10, shortly after 5:30 a.m., and involved two vehicles and a transport truck. I

articles.title: Anonymous messaging app NGL was acquired by ‘EarnPhone’ startup Mode Mobile
articles.description: Given NGL's track record of dubious growth hacking, this partnership with Mode Mobile seems like a good match.

articles.title: B.C. camping reservation window shortens to three months
articles.description: The B.C. Parks' reservation team announced the rolling window for reservations would be shortening from four months to three.

articles.title: Knife attacker kills three after smoke bombing Taiwan metro
articles.description: The suspect's spree began at Taipei's main metro before he moved to another station nearby.

articles.title: Asylum applications at Lacolle border in Quebec increased in 2025
articles.description: The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) is reporting a significant increase in asylum applications at the Saint-Bernard-de-Lacolle border crossing in Quebec. From Jan. 1 to Dec. 14, they processed about 14,900 asylum applications compared to just over 7,700 for the same period last year. Loujin Kha

articles.title: Hundreds of Cisco customers are vulnerable to new Chinese hacking campaign, researchers say
articles.description: Cisco warned that Chinese government hackers are exploiting a zero-day in some of its products. Researchers now say there are hundreds of vulnerable Cisco customers.

articles.title: Tourists to face €2 fee to get near Rome's Trevi Fountain
articles.description: Visitors who don't live in Rome will have to pay to view the Baroque monument up close from February.

articles.title: Alberta minister, new permanent chief health officer eye renewed collaboration
articles.description: Alberta’s primary care minister and the first permanent chief medical officer of health since the last one was fired in 2022 say they are looking forward to working together as the province enters a new era. Health Minister Adriana LaGrange says she believes she can build strong health systems

articles.title: Former Ottawa Senator Kyle Turris tapped by world junior team for specialty help ahead of tournament
articles.description: Kyle Turris never once felt unprepared. Every time a linesman placed the puck at centre ahead of a shootout attempt, the former NHLer was a man with a plan. articles.title: Carney names new deputy ministers for defence, justice, finance
articles.description: In one notable move, Quebec Court of Appeal judge Marie-Josée Hogue, who led Ottawa's foreign interference inquiry, becomes deputy minister of justice.
